title: What Are Some Great Top Laners?
body:
Im currently a top main and would like to know some amazing top laners in the current meta. So please, to all you challenjour players inform me on some great tanks or carry champions that could greatly imapact the game.  Im open to read any forms of text that will help me improve my performance in ranked solo queue.

fook the meta and fook maining top lane, main support and you'll be more respectable

otherwise shen singed sion swain

Ive thought of maining support a few times, but ive seem some cases of an abusive adc scream, rage, go on tilt and then afk or intentionally feed. Ive played support in normals a few times and more than half of them have been abusive even if the support hasnt done anything particularly wrong. Adc misses a cannon, supports fault. 21/0 Vi ults adc supports fault. They blame and cry like immature babies and blame every single mistake on the support like slaves.

To those suggesting singed, His playstyle his suicidal. Get tanky, dive towers, kill minions and draw people to you whilst your team takes cross map advantages. Its difficult to do if your team isnt on the same page as you. I myself am a top lane main, and the "most played" Rumble main in OCE. I find Rumble, Hecarim, Maokai, Irelia, Gnar, Vladimer, Ad Bruiser Fizz, Even Tahm kench in some situations are all viable picks. Most (apart from rumble, should be built tanky, and thus even if you only have single target damage, can still provide a decent amount of peel and protection for your carries in team fights. Fizz and rumble are quite similar in playstyle, hit a power spike, get in the oppositions face. Vlad and gnar are also similar, poke a bit, keep sustaining, then all in when you have an edge.
After reading some replies and other threads, iv'e decided to go with Gnar. Thanks for your feedback.

Singed is an extremely underplayed champion and he's usually underrated in low ELO. It's good to learn him if you're around SIlver. Other than that, Yorick has lots of potential but he can be easily countered if you know his abilities well. Yorick is so rare that most players that are around Silver won't know his potential.

Irelia, Riven, Wukong, Malphite and Shen are the best top laners at the moment IMO.

My personal favourites are currently {{champion:5}}  and {{champion:31}}.

{{champion:31}} has really good poke with his q and w (and e if you use it properly), and he becomes extremely tanky later on in the game.

{{champion:5}} has an extremely good all in at level 3, and if you kill your opponent, it means that you will most likely win lane, which will translate into tp plays, roams to mid lane, and often, winning the game.

Hope this helped

Hey man. Plat 3 top lane main here. Honestly for starters, you should just pick 3-4 _differently styled_ champions to work with and aim to get as good as you possibly can be with them.  When I say differently styled champions, I mean ones that aren't all the same both mechanic and counter-wise. 

**What you want is versatility on a relatively small scale with champions you're reasonably comfortable with** when playing, especially in draft mode such as ranked. 

For instance, there's no use learning vladimir, swain, elise and ryze as your only comfort picks, as they're all similar in the fact that they're ability power poke styled champions. Versatility is the key to success in most cases. So when you can see that the other team has locked in a teleport top lane fizz with ignite, instead of being forced to play a sustain, poke champions like the ones above (especially in the current morellonomicon meta), you're free to go with another practiced comfort pick that at least goes even matchup-wise.

My personal comfort picks while learning tops were rumble, singed, vladimir and renekton. It's honestly up to you, but I reccommend learning a few different champions with their mechanics in order to never be in an extremely unfavourable position before the game's even begun.

Hope this has helped.

Obviously you won't see the teleport/ignite, but it's a hypothetical situation in which you're garaunteed their fizz is top.

Also, try not to stroke the meta's D*** too much, solo queue isn't lcs. The meta comes and goes with patches, but individual champion competency stays forever.
